page.title: 13NOEL'S POST OFFICE
page.content: Noel gets up at 6.15 and opens the shop at 6.30.The main customers then,are the farm workers who start at 7.00.The mail comes from Peterborough to Boston and then to the Post Office at 7.00 or 7.15.There is a safe which has a time switch which opens at 9.00 when the Post Office opens.Noel and his wife have staggered meals. People come for their Pension and Family Allowance on{Mondays,Tuesdays} and {Thursdays.}They have free time on {Wednesdays, Saturdays}and all day {Sunday.}At 4.15 the mail departs again. At{5.30}the doors are locked and the open sign says closed. At{6.00}it's off to the{Cash}&{Carry.} The Post Office was built in{1903}it has been in the family for{52}years. He goes to bed at{10.30}.The heating costs{Â£25.00}a week.The shop used to sell suits,called{West End Fashions}.
